sect1.title: &KQS;
sect1.para: Known defects, limitations and work arounds with the core ZFS operations and features.

Under certain conditions zfs rollback might panic the system. Please backup your data before attempting this and we recommend that you reboot the machine and run zpool scrub should this occur..

question.para: Migrating data between solaris and linux

answer.para: Although the pool layout in this port is exactly the same as that on opensolaris there are subtle differences. Firstly ACLs are not supported and fuids are never populated in linux. Please contact us before you attempt to import a filesystem from solaris to linux. Secondly the extended attributes in linux are implemented by prefixing the attribute name with the attribute class. e.g. "user." for user attributes "security." for selinux security attributes. This imposes the restrition that any arbitrary named attribute will not exist on linux, it will have a prefix either "user" or "security". While the attributes in opensolaris can have any arbitrary name.

sect1.title: NFS shares related
sect1.para: Know problems and work arounds related export ZFS filesystems over NFS.

answer.para: This limitation will be addressed in future releases. The snapshots directories can only be accessed from the host machine or if the snapshot mount point has been explicitly exported.

zfs share command does not export the filesystem marked with sharenfs=on. The exporting is done at the time zfs set sharenfs=on tank is executed. Since this internally invokes the exportfs command the effects are equivalent if you chose to use exportfs instead of zfs sharenfs=on to export. This current limitation of "zfs share" not invoking exportfs will be fixed in a minor patch release.

question.para: How do I set nfs options while exporting

answer.para: Currently the nfs integration within the zfs command is limited to invoking exportfs. It does not give control to set the various options like "no_root_squash" or other exportfs options. If such fine grained control over the nfs export is required we recommend that you use exportfs directly.

question.para: filesystem exported via /etc/fstab doesn't show correctly on client

answer.para: Depending on your setup the nfs exports might happen before the zfs filesystems are mounted. This would result in mountpoints for the ZFS filesystems being exported instead. Unexport and re-export the /etc/fstab entries

sect1.title: Download The Binaries
sect1.para: To download &KQS; please visit our website http://www.kqstor.com/ and download the tar.gz file appropriate for your distribution and kernel version. The direct link to download is here. The name of the tar.gz file indicates the Distribution, the distro version and the kernel version for which these files are built. For example consider file "Deb_Package_Ubuntu10.4_2.6.32-25-server.tar.gz" or "zfs-fedora-2.6.35.6-48.fc14.x86_64.tar.gz". The former is for Ubuntu 10.04 running kernel 2.6.32-35 while the later is for Fedore 14 running linux kernel 2.6.35.6-48.

The tar.gz provided contains native packages for your distribution built against the supported kernel. These packages might have dependencies on other packages part of the distribution which might not be installed on your machine. You would need to respond to the error messages during installation appropriately and install the pre-requisites as required.

sect1.title: Getting support.
sect1.para: For getting support regarding any ZFS issue you should have purchased at least one license for your machine. Your license membership can be Silver, Gold or Platinum depending on your choice. You will get support as per your license membership.
For better support purchase one of the given license. For purchasing support click on "buy support" in download tab. Make sure that you are purchasing license as per your need.
For purchasing license you need to be registered user first.
Once you purchase support license you will get mail regarding license credentials. Keep you license credentials secure to avoid misuse of your license.
After purchasing license you should register your machine with KQ Infotech support system. To do that please follow the steps below:

listitem.para: Get the email-id that you have used during user registration. (*edi)
Get the password that you user for your account login. (*pswd)
Get you product key that you got with your support license purchase. (*pkey)
Login to superuser on your system and execute following at command line.
If the credentials you have provided are correct then you will get response with "Machine registered successfully" otherwise it will echo with some error message .
If zfs_manage.py is not available then make sure that you have installed ZFS package properly.

zfs_manage.py may need some additional package. So if these packages are not available then it will echo with error message indicating package unavailability. If it is the case then try to install that package manually.
Once you get echo message about successful machine registration, you will be able to get support.
For getting support you have you have to execute the same command line as for registration by changing --register option to --supprt.

Follow the instruction given after the execution of the command line. It will ask you to mail to support@kqinfotech.com with dumpxml file exported and Sysreport.tar.gz by command line as an attachment and subject as support
If you find any problem the you can contact to support@kqinfotech.com
For un-registration you have you have to execute the same command line as for registration by changing --register option to --unregister

Follow the instruction given after the execution of the command line. It will ask you to mail to support@kqinfotech.com with dumpxml file exported by command line as an attachment and subject as unregister.

question.para: Where can I get the source code ?

answer.para: The entire source code can be downloaded from https://github.com/zfs-linux

question.para: How do I build from the source code?

answer.para: A document describing how you can build is available at https://github.com/zfs-linux/zfs-web/blob/master/dev-ref/documentation.pdf. We have a script at https://github.com/zfs-linux/misc-scripts/blob/master/install.sh which can download and build automatically. These are developer tools, please use these with caution.

question.para: zpool create fails with "dir is not empty"

answer.para: The mount point specified is not empty. Make sure that the mount point does not contain any files or directories for the newly created pool to be mounted. If the mountpoint has any files created the mount will fail. This is possible if inadvertantly files were created before filesystem was mounted, at a later point if you issue "zfs mount -a" the command will fail.

question.para: Can you have &KQS; as the root filesystem

answer.para: For the current release this is not possible. We haven't planned to do this in the near future. If you think this is important please drop us a mail.
CIFS export via zfs share or zfs set sharecifs=on is not supported. However sharing with samba will work fine.
Direct IO does not perform direct IO instead falls back on buffered read/write funtions.
